snippet.title: Holiday home burglar a serial offender
snippet.content: DETECTIVES believe a burglar is targeting peninsula holiday homes, with seven similar break-ins over the past month. Mornington Peninsula Crime Investigation Unit officers say the series of thefts have the same method of entry, with doors and windows being forced, and similar types of large items stolen. Since July 9 there have been five burglaries at Merricks Beach, one at Point Leo and one at Shoreham. The five Merricks Beach burglaries were at Spray St, Bluff Rd, Surf St and two at different addresses in Cliff Rd. Thefts have also taken place at Lesley Avenue, Point Leo, and Myers Drive in Shoreham. Investigators believe the offenders may be using a trailer, ute or truck due to the size of the items stolen. Information: Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000 or click .
